ygData.subject: A shot in the Dark.
ygData.msgSnippet: The sound of roaring jets and laser fire had never left Tucson s ears.  Even though the wars were past, his memory of that one brutal battle against Decepticon

The sound of roaring jets and laser fire had never left Tucson's ears.  Eve=
n though the wars were past, his memory of that one brutal battle against D=
ecepticon foe remains as sharp as if it had just happened a day or so befor=
e.  

Things were different now.  There was talk of peace with Megatron.  T=
he thought of putting differences asside was comforting yet he wasn't quite=
 sure he could ever forgive any Decepticon for what was done against his co=
mrades and himself.  He finds himself betwixed between being happy and feel=
ing frustrated.  But Frustration would soon be melted away with the thought=
s of a little leisurely target practice, involving make shift targets.  

"=
 Time to see if those adjustments I made on your mechanisms will optimize y=
our performance."

With a weak smile, he feels for his cross bow, and scans=
 his left hand into a quiver of arrows, taking one gingerly and placing it =
inside his weapon.  As if he had his optics in full working order, Tucson m=
anages to load his weapon swiftly and raises the cross bow to meet the heig=
ht of his target.  Before aiming and firing, he sends a sonar wave to bounc=
e off the target, giving him ample information as to where to aim his arrow=
 head.  He finds it quickly, and releases the trigger.  

The swish of a fa=
st flying arrow soon meets the target with an explosion of ample force, as =
his target is struck but not with the accuracy he had been hoping for, nor =
with the force.

"Hmmm, that didn't sound too bad, but not exactly what I w=
as hoping to accomplish.  I think I better scan over your mechanisms once m=
ore."

He takes the cross bow and sits down on a boulder of alloy, scanning=
 his fingers over the cross bow's springs, and trigger mechanisms.  The wea=
pon was of his own making and Tucson would only be satisfied with it when i=
t performed to it's optimal performance level.
